_header: If thou be rich and wise in lore
Note:
See Walther (1969)
XWalther, Hans. Initia carmina ac versuum medii aevi posterioris latinorum. Göttingen, 1959; 2nd ed. 1969, no. 17998.
_description: The fruits of pride — one quatrain translating ‘Si tibi copia si sapientia formaque detur’ which precedes it in John Grimestone’s preaching notebook

NLS18721.Transcription:
[ȝ]ef þu be riche & wys in loreIn tunge
                    gracious[Pri]de destruiȝet þis an moreFor he is
                    venimous
NLS18721.Editions:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             A Descriptive Index of the English Lyrics in John of Grimestone’s
                Preaching Book.
Medium Ævum Monographs
         n.s. 2. Oxford, 1973: 59.
